hero.name: Kevin Patterson
hero.fullStackDeveloper: Cybersecurity Engineer & Full Stack Web Developer
hero.content: I’m a passionate Cybersecurity Engineer and Web Developer, specialized in creating robust, scalable, and secure web applications. I study Cybersecurity Engineering at the University of Informatics Sciences (UCI) in Havana and have solid hands-on experience with modern technologies such as React, Next.js, Node.js, Django, PostgreSQL, and MySQL, combined with an advanced focus on offensive and defensive security. I have participated in Capture the Flag competitions, vulnerability analysis projects, E2E test automation, and perimeter protection using tools like Nmap, Wireshark, Burp Suite, Nessus, Metasploit, Shodan, and OpenVAS, among others. I also have experience in Cyber Intelligence and OSINT, applying methodologies for early detection of data leaks, exposure of critical services, and corporate digital footprint analysis, supported by tools such as Maltego, SpiderFoot, theHarvester, Shodan, and Google Dorks.

about.text: Since I was very young, technology and its endless possibilities have fascinated me. As a committed full stack developer, I combine creativity with technical expertise to design and develop high-performance, user-friendly web applications, always adding a focus on security. With 3 years of professional experience, I have honed my skills with modern tools and frameworks, integrating security into every stage of development — from system architecture to deployment and monitoring. My goal is to transform innovative ideas into secure digital solutions that drive business growth and deliver exceptional user experiences without compromising data integrity or privacy.

experiences.description: At the University of Informatics Sciences (UCI), I participated in the design and implementation of an information system for the comprehensive management of the university's extension events. This project aimed to optimize the registration, control, and monitoring of cultural, sports, and academic activities, facilitating traceability and real-time information analysis. I applied the agile SCRUM methodology with daily meetings with the client to ensure continuous communication, iterative delivery of features, and an efficient, stable, and well-aligned final product.

At UCI, I develop scalable web applications using Python, Django, PostgreSQL, Nest.js, and React.js. I collaborate closely with multidisciplinary teams, valuing clear communication and trust as we build solutions that truly enhance user experience, security, and system performance.
At UCI, I was responsible for training an AI model for the automated detection of phishing emails.
At CITMATEL, I focused on designing and developing an Automated Web Hosting Management System. This experience deepened my understanding of process automation and its importance.
As an independent personal project, I developed a methodology for open-source information search and analysis to detect data leaks and exposure of critical services early.

At UCI, I developed a Food Recipe Management web application. I collaborated closely with a professional team, valuing clear communication and trust throughout the project, always prioritizing user experience and security above all.

During my internship at CACSA, I was responsible for developing a web platform for cybersecurity services (CAS) and implementing an automated perimeter protection service based on Cloudflare. The agile SCRUM methodology was used, and I played an active role in sprint planning, creating user stories, and defining acceptance criteria. I also held daily meetings with the client and development team to ensure alignment with functional requirements, product quality, and continuous value delivery.

At CACSA, I was responsible for conducting passive and active vulnerability analysis on corporate web pages, assessing detected vulnerabilities, monitoring and analyzing the corporate network, applying data correlation techniques from open sources to support digital forensic analysis, creating and implementing checklists, and auditing the company's premises.
At ECNA, I was in charge of analyzing corporate Squid proxy web traces, evaluating them and collecting digital forensic evidence following the proper incident management cycle.

At Rollo, I led the frontend development of an intelligent SaaS platform for thermal labeling in Food and Retail. I enjoyed working with a dedicated team where our collaborative efforts made a real impact on daily operations.
During my internship at ECNA, I was responsible for performing automated E2E testing on the institution’s web platforms, ensuring their functionality, availability, and integrity.

As a thesis project to obtain the degree of Cybersecurity Engineer, I designed and implemented an automated perimeter protection service based on Cloudflare, integrating security controls, provisioning automation, and best practices. This project aims to improve the resilience and availability of web platforms by mitigating DDoS attacks, filtering malicious traffic, and ensuring secure access through WAF policies and rate limiting.

Working as a freelance developer allows me to create custom web solutions for real-world challenges across different communities. This hands-on experience not only strengthens my technical skills but also reinforces the importance of understanding and adapting to each client’s unique needs.
